column2: Here you go Pheebs. Who else wants one of my special homemade brownies? '
I will have one. (Ross and him both take one.)'
Okay, I\xc2\x92m not gonna have one.'
Neither will I. (they both put back the brownies.)'
No, no, it\xc2\x92s just my tooth.'
All right I\xc2\x92ll have one. (he and Ross take another brownie,)'
So what\xc2\x92s a matter, you need a dentist? I\xc2\x92ve got a good one.'
No thanks, I have a good one too. I just, I, I can\xc2\x92t see him.'
See that is the problem with invisible dentists.'
Why? Why can\xc2\x92t you go to him?'
Because, every time I go to the dentist, somebody dies.'
That is so weird, because every time I go to the dentist, I look down\nthe hygienist\xc2\x92s blouse.'
Phoebe, what? Umm...what?!'
Yeah, yeah, first there was my aunt Mary, and then there was umm, John,\nmy mailman, and then my, my cowboy friend \xc2\x91Albino Bob\xc2\x92.'
And all these people actually died?'
Yes, while I was in the chair! That\xc2\x92s why I take such good care of\nmy teeth now, y'know, it\xc2\x92s not about oral hygiene, I floss to save lives!"
Pheebs, come on, you didn\xc2\x92t kill anybody, these people just happened\nto die when you went to the dentist. It\xc2\x92s, it\xc2\x92s, it\xc2\x92s just ah, a\ncoincidence.'
Well tell that to them. Oh! You can\xc2\x92t, their dead.'
Thanks, Gunther. (takes the plate Gunther serves him and Rachel comes up\nand kisses him) (to Rachel) Hey! (to Gunther) Umm, can I get a napkin too?'
Oh, like you don\xc2\x92t already have everything.'
(trying to bite into an apple) Ow! Ow! (drops the apple in disgust.)'
Phoebe, your in pain, would you just go to the dentist, just go.'
All right, fine, fine, but if you\xc2\x92re my next victim, don\xc2\x92t\ncome back as a poltergeist and like suck me into the TV set.'
I promise.'
Although, don\xc2\x92t feel like you can\xc2\x92t visit.'
(entering with Monica) Hey, is, is, is Chandler here?'
(patting his clothes like he is looking for his wallet) No, no he\xc2\x92s\nnot.'
You guys, Joey just saw Janice kissing her ex-husband.'
What? (to Joey) So what are you going to do? I mean how, how are you going\nto tell Chandler?'
Well, I was thinking about that and I, I think the best way would be, to\nnot.'
Joey, you can\xc2\x92t keep this to yourself, if you know about this, you\nhave to tell him.'
It\xc2\x92ll kill him. I mean it\xc2\x92ll, it\xc2\x92ll just kill him.'
Well, you could wait \xc2\x91til I go to the dentist, maybe I\xc2\x92ll\nkill him.'
(looking out the window) Ewww! Ugly Naked Guy is using his new hammock.\nIt\xc2\x92s like a Play-Doo Fat Factory. '

Well, I\xc2\x92m going to the dentist, so listen, okay, just be on the
look out for anything that, that, that you can fall into, or, or that can fall on you,
or... All right, just look out! Okay, And um, I also just wanna, I just wanna tell you all
that um...... (starts to cry and runs out)'
Okay, I have a problem I have to go into work for a few hours, some kids\nmessed up the Homo Sapien display.'
What did they do?'
Well, they painted over the word \xc2\x91Sapien\xc2\x92 for one thing, then\nthey rearranged the figures, let\xc2\x92s just leave it at that.'
So, do you want me to watch Ben for you?'
Yes, that\xc2\x92s what I was going to ask, thank you.'
Whoa! Wait! Hello! What about me?'

You? You! Want to watch Ben? (in the background Monica mouths
\xc2\x91Don\xc2\x92t worry, I\xc2\x92ll be here the whole time.\xc2\x92 to Ross.) Yes! That\xc2\x92d
be great, no, I just wanted to ask Monica, because I know how empty her life is. (Monica
sarcastically mouths \xc2\x91Yeah!\xc2\x92 and holds up her thumb.)'
Hey-hey, Ross?'
Yeah.'
I\xc2\x92ve got a science question.'
Hmm?'
If the Homo Sapiens, were in fact \xc2\x91Homo-sapien\xc2\x92, is that why\nthere extinct?'
Joey, Homo Sapiens are people.'
Hey-hey, I\xc2\x92m not judging.'
(holding Ben) Look Benny, spoon. (moves it back and forth) Spoon. Come\non! All right, y'know what I think he\xc2\x92s bored."

Here. Ben, do you wanna play the airplane game, do you wanna show
Rachel? Come here. (takes Ben) We\xc2\x92re gonna do something fun. Okay. (throws Ben up in
the air a little bit and catches him) Weee!! (moves into the living room and does it
again) Weee!! (starts to walk back into the kitchen as she does it again, and hits
Ben\xc2\x92s head on that wooden beam across the ceiling.)'
(to Ben) Who\xc2\x92s so brave, you\xc2\x92re so brave, yes you are,\nyou\xc2\x92re so brave.'

Okay. Okay honey, he\xc2\x92s fine, he\xc2\x92s fine, let\xc2\x92s just put\nhim down. Come here, Ben. (sets him on the couch) See that\xc2\x92s a good boy. (to Monica)\nHow could you do that to him!! Ross trusted me, what is he going to say?!'
He\xc2\x92s not gonna say anything, because we\xc2\x92re not gonna tell him.'
We\xc2\x92re not?!'
No we\xc2\x92re not.'
All right, I like that. '
Okay.'
So we\xc2\x92re okay, we\xc2\x92re okay, we\xc2\x92re okay, (starts to exam\nBen) aren\xc2\x92t we? No, we\xc2\x92re not okay, we\xc2\x92re not okay, there\xc2\x92s a bump,\nthere\xc2\x92s a bump.'
Oh my God! Well push it in! Push it in!'
I cannot push it in!'
Okay, we\xc2\x92re gonna need a distraction.'
Okay, okay, okay.'
I got it!'
Okay.'
The second that Ross walks in that door, I want you take him back to\nyour bedroom and do whatever it is that you do that makes him go, (high pitched) rweee!!'
Or. We could put a hat on his head.'
A hat! Yes! We need a hat.'
We need a hat..'
Where are we gonna find a tiny little hat?'
Oh, oh, oh, I\xc2\x92ll get \xc2\x91Rainy Day Bear\xc2\x92!! (runs to get him)'
Because he\xc2\x92ll know what to do? (Rachel comes out of her room with a\nbear that\xc2\x92s dressed in a rain suit.) Oh my God, you\xc2\x92re a genius!'
Oh God, oh God, it\xc2\x92s sowed on though.'
Give it. Give it.'
Okay.'
Oh!!'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s just like a bloodbath in here today.'
Hey! Hold on a minute, hold on a second. Do you think these pearls are\nnice?'
I\xc2\x92d really prefer a mountain bike.'
Janice\xc2\x92s birthday is coming up, I want to get her something\nspeacial. Come in here with me.'
Whoa, whoa, whoa, wait, whoa. Do you ah, want to get her something\nspeacial, get her flowers, get her candy, get her gum, girls love gum.'
That\xc2\x92s a good idea, \xc2\x91Dear Janice have a Hubba-Bubba\nbirthday\xc2\x92. I would like to get her something serious.'
Oh, you want something serious. Y'know what you should do, you should get\nher one of those um, barium enemas. Those are dead serious."
All right. Look, I\xc2\x92m gonna go in here, and you don\xc2\x92t buy me\nanything ever. (starts to go into the store)'
(stopping him) No, no, you can\xc2\x92t, you can\xc2\x92t, okay, you\ncan\xc2\x92t, you can\xc2\x92t buy her pearls, you just can\xc2\x92t, you can\xc2\x92t, you\ncan\xc2\x92t.'
Why not?!'
Oh God. Uh, okay, here\xc2\x92s the thing, this is the thing, okay, the\nthing is...'
What is the thing?'
Okay. I went down to the \xc2\x91Mattress King\xc2\x92 showroom and, and I saw\nJanice, kissing her ex-husband.'
(shocked) What?'
They were in his office.'
Well she, she wouldn\xc2\x92t do that, she\xc2\x92s with, she\xc2\x92s with\nme.'
I\xc2\x92m telling you man, I saw it.'
Yeah, well, you\xc2\x92re wrong! Okay, you\xc2\x92re wrong.'
I\xc2\x92m not wrong! I wish I was. I\xc2\x92m sorry. Bet that barium enema\ndoesn\xc2\x92t sound so bad now, huh?'
It just makes more sense as an ensemble.'
Right.'
Besides, it takes the focus off the hat.'
(running through the door) No! Oh! You\xc2\x92re alive! You\xc2\x92re alive!'
See Pheebs, I promised you no one would die, didn\xc2\x92t I?'
Yeah, well, we\xc2\x92ll see about that. Can I use your phone? I just\nwanna call everyone I know.'
Sure, we have no money, go ahead.'
(on phone) \xc2\x91Hey! You\xc2\x92re not dead! Okay, see ya!\xc2\x92'
Monica.'
Oh my God! He just said my name! Did you hear that?'
Monica bang!'
Okay, I heard that.'
Did he just say \xc2\x91Monica bang\xc2\x92?'
Uh-huh.'
Oh my God! He\xc2\x92s gonna rat me out!'
Monica bang!'

Oh-ho-ho, sweetie, sweetie, you gotta stop saying that, now. It\xc2\x92s
no big deal, it\xc2\x92s not even worth mentioning, you see we all do it all the time. See
watch this, Ben, Ben, Ben. (goes over and starts hitting her head on the post) Ow, Monica
bang! (does it again) Everybody bang. (repeats) Ben bang. (repeats) Rachel bang. (repeats)
Bang, Rachel bang! Oh, isn\xc2\x92t that fun?'
(goes over and hits her head on the post) Look at that! (repeats) Look\nat that! (repeats) We all do it. (repeats) Okay, I\xc2\x92m stopping now.'
You okay?'
Oh yeah! Y'know, if it\xc2\x92s not a headboard, it\xc2\x92s just not worth\nit."
(entering) How\xc2\x92s my Bing-a-ling?'
Ah, I don\xc2\x92t know, you tell me. Anything you ah, wanna tell me,\nbecause, if you ah, you should, if you, you would, tell me.'
Why are your eyes so white?'
You tell me! Maybe, it\xc2\x92s because I was just fooling with my ex!\nOh no-no-no-no, no-no-no-no, that was you!!'
Oh my God!!'
All right!'
How did you know?'
Joey told me, he saw you two kissing.'
In the park?'
No! In his office! How many kisses were there?'
Just those two!'
Wh-wh-why, wh-why, why, why was there kissing!? There should be no\nkissing!!'

Oh, I\xc2\x92m sorry honey, I\xc2\x92m so, so, (nasally) haaaaa! I\xc2\x92m\nso, so sorry, I just (nasally) haaaaaa! But I, oh what happened was, I-I-I can\xc2\x92t\nbreathe. Can you get me a bag, or something?'
(giving her a bag) Here.'
The receipt.'

I\xc2\x92ll take it! All right look, I gotta know. Are you finished with
me? (Janice shakes her head no) Are you finished with him? (Janice shakes her head no) Do
you still love him? (Janice shakes her head yes) Do you still love me? (Janice shakes her
head yes) All right look, (grabs the bag) I\xc2\x92m gonna need an actual answer here okay,
so which is it, him or me? (his phone starts to ring)'
I don\xc2\x92t know.'
(rushing in) Okay. If you\xc2\x92re alive you answer your phone!'
Okay, Ben, I won\xc2\x92t tell your daddy that you had ice cream for\ndinner, if you don\xc2\x92t tell about our little bonking incident.'
Monica, number one, I don\xc2\x92t think Ben understands the concept of\nbribery, and number two, I... (Joey starts laughing in the background) (to Joey) What?!'
You said number two.'
I also said number one.'
I know. (giggles harder)'
(entering) Hey! Everyone.'
Hi!'
How\xc2\x92s my little boy?'
He\xc2\x92s perfect, he\xc2\x92s never been better.'
(noticing the outfit he is wearing) What\xc2\x92d you do, take him whaling?'
Monica.'
Oh my God, he just said your name, that\xc2\x92s great! Good job Ben.'
Monica bang!'
Oh that\xc2\x92s right, that\xc2\x92s what I\xc2\x92d sound like if I\nexploded.'
Woo-Hoo! The curse is broken! I called everybody I know, and everyone is\nalive.'
Uh.'
What?'
Ugly Naked Guy looks awfully still. (Phoebe runs to the window and gasps.)'
Oh my God! I killed him! I killed another one! And this curse is getting\nstronger too, to bring down something that big.'
Well maybe he\xc2\x92s just taking a nap.'
I\xc2\x92m tellin\xc2\x92 ya, he hasn\xc2\x92t moved since this morning.'
All right, we should call somebody.'
And tell them what? The naked guy we stare at all the time isn\xc2\x92t\nmoving.'
Well, we have gotta find out if he\xc2\x92s alive.'
How are we gonna do that? There\xc2\x92s no way.'
Well, there is one way. His window\xc2\x92s open, I say, we poke him.'
Hey! Y'know how we ah, save all those chopsticks for no reason we get when\nwe get Chinese food?"
Yeah.'
Well, now we got a reason.'
What?'
Well, we\xc2\x92re fashioning a very long poking device.'
All right.'
Hey uh, what\xc2\x92s a matter?'
I talked to Janice.'
Oh my God, is she going back to him?'

She doesn\xc2\x92t know. Says she loves us both. Y'know I woke up this
morning and I was in love, well I was happy. Y'know it serves me right for buying that
twelve pack of condoms. And now I can\xc2\x92t even return them, because she choked on the
reciept!"
What are you ah, what are you gonna do?'
I don\xc2\x92t know, y'know. What, what, would you do?"
Well, it doesn\xc2\x92t matter what I would do.'
Come on, tell me.'
All right, you\xc2\x92re probably not gonna want to hear this but ah, if it\nwas me, and this is just me, (Chandler gets ready to throw another dart) I would ah, I\nwould bow out.'
What? (turns around quickly still ready to throw the dart and Joey\nquickly ducks and hides behind the chair) What are you, what are you talking about?'

They have a kid together, y'know. They\xc2\x92re like, they\xc2\x92re like a
family, and if, I don\xc2\x92t know, there\xc2\x92s chance they could make that work, I know I
wouldn\xc2\x92t want to be the guy who stood in the way of that. Are you okay? Do you wanna
ah, come poke a nude guy?"
Well, he\xc2\x92s finally alseep. About that ah, bump on his head?'
Are you, are you, are you sure it\xc2\x92s ah, a new bump? I mean, no\noffense, I\xc2\x92ve always thought of Ben as a fairly bumpy headed child.'
It\xc2\x92s okay if he bumps his head, kids bump their heads all the time,\ny'know, it was your first time babysitting, I figured you did the best you could."
(confidently) I did!'
I know! I\xc2\x92m saying you have to watch them all the time.'
I did!! I watched! I watched! I watched Monica bang his head against\nthat thing!'
Monica did it?'
Monica?'
Yeah.'
Umm, did you notice anything wierd about Ben today?'
No. Why?'

Well, I was just playing with him, and y'know we were doing the alphabet\nsong, which he used to be really good at, but suddenly he\xc2\x92s leaving out \xc2\x91e\xc2\x92\nand \xc2\x91f.\xc2\x92 It\xc2\x92s like they just ah, I don\xc2\x92t know, fell out of his head."
Really?!'

Oh, and also, he\xc2\x92s, he\xc2\x92s walkin\xc2\x92 kind of funny, his left\nleg is moving a lot faster than his right leg, and he\xc2\x92s in there just sort of\ny'know... (walks around in a circle) "
Oh my God, I wrecked your baby!! (runs into the bedroom)'
I hope it\xc2\x92s still funny when you\xc2\x92re in hell.'
(coming out of the bedroom) You jerk! You know how much I love that kid!\n(starts to chase Ross around the living room)'
Monica bang! Monica bang! (runs into one of the posts) Ow!'
I\xc2\x92ll get the hat.'
Janice, I have something I need to tell you, and I want you to let me\nget through it, because it\xc2\x92s, it\xc2\x92s, it\xc2\x92s not gonna be easy.'
Okay.'

I think you should go back with Gary. I don\xc2\x92t wanna be the guy
that breaks up a family, y'know when my parents split up, it was because of that guy.
Whenever I would see him I was always think y'know \xc2\x91You\xc2\x92re the reason, you are
the reason why their not together.\xc2\x92 and I hated that guy. And it didn\xc2\x92t matter
how nice he was, or how happy he made my Dad."
Wow!'
Yeah, well. It\xc2\x92s the right thing to do.'

Oh! You\xc2\x92re right. Oh God. But, before I can say
\xc2\x91good-bye\xc2\x92, there\xc2\x92s something I really need you to know, Chandler. The way
I feel about you, it\xc2\x92s like, I finally understand what Lionel Richie\xc2\x92s been
singing about. Y'know, I mean what we have, it\xc2\x92s like movie love, you\xc2\x92re my
soulmate, and I can\xc2\x92t believe we\xc2\x92re not going to be spending the rest of our
lives together."
Then don\xc2\x92t leave me!'
What?'
Forget what I said, I was babbling! Pick me!'
No, you were right, you were right. I mean, I-I-I\xc2\x92ve got to give my\nmarriage another chance.'
No you don\xc2\x92t! No, no, no, I say you have to give your divorce\nanother chance.'
(standing up) I\xc2\x92m sorry. (hugs him)'
Ohhh. Don\xc2\x92t go.'
No, I-I-I gotta go. (she starts to walk away, but Chandler doesn\xc2\x92t\nlet her go.)'
No. No! No! No!'
Honey, honey, people are looking.'
I don\xc2\x92t care! (turns around and to the people watching them) I\ndon\xc2\x92t care!!'
Yeah, um, I\xc2\x92m, I\xc2\x92m leaving now. (tries to get her leg out of\nChandler\xc2\x92s grasp, she finally does, but Chandler takes off her shoe.)'
You can\xc2\x92t leave! I have your shoe!'
Good-bye Chandler Bing. (walks out with one shoe)'
Rachel has those in burgendy.'
All right now remember, something this big and long is going to be\ndifficult to manuver, fortunately I have a lot of experience in that area.'
Can we please focus here, a naked man\xc2\x92s life hangs in the balance!'
I\xc2\x92m telling you he\xc2\x92s dead. What we are about to have here is a\ndead fat guy on a stick.'

All right, ladies and gentlemen, let\xc2\x92s poke. (they start to advance
the giant poking device) Steady. Steady. Okay, a little higher. Careful of the angle.
Okay, okay, we\xc2\x92re approaching the window (as he says this the camera cuts to their
view of Ugly Naked Guy, so that we actually see him!) Thread the needle. Thread the
needle. '
He\xc2\x92s alive! He\xc2\x92s a-live!!!'
And yet, we\xc2\x92re still poking him.'
Okay, retract the device, retract the device.'
He does not look happy.'
Hey-hey, now he\xc2\x92s showing us his poking device.'
Hey, that\xc2\x92s never gonna make it all the way over here, buddy!'
(singing) I\xc2\x92ll hold you close in my arms. (Phoebe\nenters) I can\xc2\x92t resist your charms. And love....'
(joining him) Love....'
I\xc2\x92ll be a fool for you. I\xc2\x92m sure, you know I\ndon\xc2\x92t mind.'
(high pitched) No you know I don\xc2\x92t mind.'
Yes! You mean the world the world to me. Oh...'
I know.'
I know.'
I\xc2\x92ve found.'
I\xc2\x92ve found....'

...in you, my endless (Phoebe goes high pitched,\nChandler goes low pitched) love. (they both look at each other.) My endless\nlove. (once again they don\xc2\x92t match tones, and they just look at each other)'
